intro: Tateanthus duidae, commonly known as the golden tasselbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Tateanthus duidae is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
